description: From Latin dissociat-, from dissociare, from dis- + sociare.

verbs.description: dissociate (third-person singular simple present dissociates, present participle dissociating, simple past and past participle dissociated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make unrelated; to sever a connection; to separate.
examples: A number of group members wish to dissociate themselves from the majority.
After the big fight, the gang totally dissociated from each other.

entries.meaning: (chemistry, transitive) To separate compounds into simpler component parts, usually by applying heat or through electrolysis.
examples: We dissociated the lead iodide into its elements by heating
Gerald checked himself into the hospital because he was dissociating.
